alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Lake; Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 07 at 8:52PM EDT until May 08 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Indiana, including the following areas, Jasper, Lake IN and Newton. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 748 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated slow-moving, heavy thunderstorms which have produced 1 inch of rain across a narrow corridor from near Schneider to near Gifford. These thunderstorms may continue to produce rain rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour over the next few hours. Localized flooding may develop shortly. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Crown Point, Cedar Lake, Lowell, Rensselaer, DeMotte, Wheatfield, Lake Village, Dyer, St. John, Roselawn, Lake Dalecarlia, Shelby, Hanging Grove, Collegeville, Schneider, Mount Ayr, Fair Oaks, Parr, Thayer and Stoutsburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
